content.description: Start as per Prometheus. Climb through shouldery crimps and gastons to finish on 'V2.'

Sit start with both hands on a jug rail. Make a large RH move to a side pull crimp. Swap the feet and stick a LH side pull crimp. Match and then hit a LH gaston. Either match or cross to the jugs. Top out up and right on good holds.
content.location: Right hand side of boulder, looking up stream. Obvious rails on steep overhanging face.

content.description:
SDS on a horizontal jug rail and climb a few moves to gain a good right hand pinch. Drops down from a large sloping jug and a leftward facing jug below the lip. If you can find a way to top it out, do so. A variation from the SDS exiting through the hole out right has also been done, and is of approximately the same difficulty. 

  Originally done as a stand start halfway up the wall from a left-hand crimp and a high right-hand sloping pinch.  

  Number 14

climbs.name: Odin's Revenge Stand Right
climbs.fa: Matt Fowls, Kristian Fowls, Ian Evans

content.description: Stand start spanned out on a bulgy hold out right past the small, sharp sidepull, a leftwards-facing pinch, and a big left foot on the obvious sloping pod. Climb Odin's Revenge Stand and trend right to exit on the tallest part of the face (Hall of Heroes).  Number 10.

climbs.name: Odin's Revenge Stand
climbs.fa: Matt Fowls, Kristian Fowls, Ian Evans

content.description:
Stand start spanned out on a bulgy hold far out right past the small, sharp sidepull, a leftwards-facing pinch, and a big left foot on the obvious sloping pod.  

  Number 9 on the picture topo.

Climb Odin's Revenge, but exit right on the tallest part of the face by grabbing the right hand pocket-pinch of Hall of Heroes. Number 8. 

  VAR: Stand start spanned out on a bulgy hold out right past the small, sharp sidepull, a leftwards-facing pinch, and a big left toe on the obvious sloping pod. Number 10.

climbs.name: Odin's Revenge
climbs.fa: Matt Fowls, Ian Evans, Kristian Fowls

content.description:
Starts on a big sloping pod below the lip in the center of the boulder. Make a move out right to a small, sharp sidepull, and climb compression moves to top out on V2. This climb gets significantly more difficult with less span.  

  Number 7 on the picture topo.

Begin on the sloping pod of Odins Revenge and traverse the lip leftward on sloping holds into 'V4'. High water levels render this problem unworkable for significant portions of the year. Recommended. 

  Number 5 on the picture topo
Start on 'V2' and finish on Odin's Revenge Right
The Lost World into Odin's Revenge. Begin matched on the most positive slope, just to the right of the arete. Make some spread out moves on slopes and edges to gain the start of Odin's Revenge.
content.location: Begins matched on the most positive slope, just to the right of the arete.

content.description: Start at the bottom right of the rail feature that  "The V2" starts off of, underclinging the bottom with your left hand. Climb out the rail/rib feature up and left, then deadpoint to the slopey ball on Odin's Revenge. Come in to a nearby edge for the right, hold the swing, then top out up and left through new terrain.
content.protection: A few pads–the landing is a bit complex.
content.location: Steep face of the River Boulder, with right hand on the bottom of the obvious rail and left hand underclinging the underside of the feature.

content.description: Make the hard move on the SDS to 'V4' and link into the start of Odins Revenge by traversing slopes along the lip. Finish by climbing Odin's Revenge. Contrived.

Sit Start to 'V4'. Begin right hand on a sloping dish on the right underside of the arête, and left on a polished edge left of the arête. Find feet and make a gigantic move into the stand.  

  Number 3

Climb the vertical face of the boulder opposite of Prometheus. Start sitting any way you can, and embark up sloping edges to top out on the right side of the boulder.  

  Number 15

Climb the overhanging face left of 'V4'. Polished, thin, and hard.  

  Sometimes this problem is unworkable due to high water levels. 

  Number 1
Unlikely left arete. Essentially one move: paste your feet in, then chuck for the jug.
content.location: left corner of boulder from downstream.

content.description: A bit off the deck. Start on jug in muddle of downstream face.
content.location: start on obvious jug, go up.

content.description: Three problems 2 minutes from the parking lot make this boulder well worth it.
